+import * as React from 'react';
+import withStyles, { WithStyles, StyleRules } from '@material-ui/core/styles/withStyles';
+
+const styles = (): StyleRules => {
+  return {
+    gridWrapper: {
+      height: '100%',
+
+      '& .grid.grid-container.grid-compact': {
+        maxHeight: '100%',
+
+        '& .grid-row': {
+          gridTemplateColumns: '1fr 2fr 1fr 1fr',
+          gridColumnGap: '50px',
+        },
+      },
+    },
+  };
+};
+
+interface IConnectivityAssessmentProps extends WithStyles<typeof styles> {
+  connectivity: any;

nodes.bodyText: Can we use the heading component here, and for the other headings?
Doesn't look like this is needed

This naming is a little bit confusing to me and doesn't sound like it would be a boolean value. It looks like if viewMore is false, that means they are not viewing the full config (i.e. they are not viewing more currently). Maybe "viewingMore"?
This wording sounds incomplete - maybe "See more/less configuration properties"?
this is from the mock up
Comment about where/which components this is coming from?
Any specific reason why we use !important? Can you add a comment?
